description:
The children help the little witch to cook a porridge. Only certain ingredients (objects) that fit into a given category are allowed in. Does the ball belong with the toys? Do the shoes match the clothes? Is the tractor a vehicle?

This game stimulates language development and builds vocabulary.

For older children there is a variant:
Each child receives a screen, a category tile and 4 objects. One by one, each player chooses another player and asks them for a specific item that fits their category.
The first to own the 4 items that belong to their category wins.

Mein erstes Sprech-Hexchen is a variant for very young children of Die freche Sprech-Hexe.

STACKS is a set collection game built around collecting sets of red, blue, and green cards. The cards may be in a central array on the table, in front of a player, or in a player's hand.

On their turn a player will either play 1 card from their hand or the top card of the deck to the central array.  Alternatively, they can play a set of cards (one of each type) to the central array.  Depending upon the adjacencies of colors and certain card effects, the card which was played may have its effect triggered or the player may be forced to acquire cards.

The game will end when the deck runs out of cards.  Then, each player scores points for cards left in their hand and cards in front of them.  Any sets of cards (one of each type) in front of them can be combined into a single card. The player with the fewest points wins.

Introducing the best board game for little fans of Everdell, My Lil Everdell. Join Chip, Sweep, and the other kids of Everdell to build the most spectacular make-believe city anyone has ever built.  This easy to learn worker-placement and tableau building game will provide family fun while getting the lil’ ones' brains a buzzin’, improving focus and enhancing young learner skills.  Climb across the rope bridge, watch out for the dragon’s den, and join us in the fort for the latest addition to the award-winning Everdell line, My Lil Everdell.

—description from the publisher

Peleia is a variant of Stratego, with typical characters from southern Brazil.

It also introduces a few new elements, such as cards and dice, and it's played with an 8x10 board - altogether turning the matches more dynamic than Stratego.

Most pieces move according to an asymmetric dice - which contain three sides 01, two sides 02, and one side 03.

Each player receives 03 cards, with which they can change the regular mechanics of the game.

With the card "Não tá morto quem peleia", you decide on a fight/encounter by rolling a D6 rather than by the characters/pieces' rankings.

With the card "Às brinca", you can cancel an attack that, otherwise, you'd lose.

With the card "Traíra", you can reveal one of your opponent's pieces.

—description from the designer

Instant Saga is a drafting game where players select a team of Vikings to then attempt to land at four locations.

The Viking cards show certain colors, which indicate which islands they can land on. Viking cards which do not help capture a land card are sent to Valhalla, and may score points in a secondary manner.

If a player does not contribute at least 1 card to a landing attempt, they are eliminated from the game.

The player with the most points wins.

Order up! Thank you, chef! In Fast Food Fury you and your team of food truck chefs need to work in a chaotic festival environment to prepare orders for hungry customers, while another team tries to fulfil the same orders. For every order you fulfil, you have a happy customer that will pay the bill. So make sure your team serves the most customers and earns the most money.

How does it work?

     You and your team are chefs of different food trucks, all attending the same festival.
     Every player simultaneously flips open a fast food card and tries to hit the product they need for the order their working on.
     If they were the first, they win the product and strategically place it with their order. They need to be


smart with their products, to be quicker and better than the other team(s).

     The team that finishes their order first, pleases the customer and wins their cash.
     Special sauce cards add an extra dash of chaos and confusion.
     The team that wins the most cash, wins the game!


—description from the publisher

Flieg, Dino is a cooperative game about the world of feelings. Together with the flying dinosaur Tika, kids learn to explore and identify different emotions and learn how to deal with them.
‘Scene cards’ picture various scenarios showcasing different emotions (joy, sorrow, anger, fear, pride and shame). By rolling dice, players are trying to match the shown emotions to acquire feathers. The objective of this game is to gather enough of these feathers to enable Tika to finally fly and escape a rumbling volcano.
Furthermore, some of the ‘Scene cards’ also address the topic of addiction, and emotions which may come up for kids confronted with those topics.
This game was developed in cooperation with NACOA, and its usage is intended for Kindergartens. Kindergarten teachers can utilize Flieg, Dino to introduce children to the topic of addiction in a safe, pedagogical and easy to grasp way. Simultaneously kids are encouraged to talk about their feelings in a playful environment.

In this game, each player begins by spreading their neighboring player's penguins on the 61-hexagon board (which has 7 holes in it).

Later each player tries to gather their own penguins in one group. On their turn, a player will move a penguin to an adjacent space or jump over one or more other penguins. If a penguin lands on one of the holes, it will emerge from another hole if possible.

This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with 3 questions each, most of them with multiple choice options. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information. Most of the cards also show small illustrations.

The title translates to "Modern general knowledge" and includes questions about all kinds of events from the last decade, ranging from politics to pop culture.

The legendary tanukis, also known as the Japanese raccoon dog, are reputed to be mischievous and jolly masters of disguise within Japanese folklore. Show your determination and reign supreme in this fierce and adorable card game.

Welcome to the vibrant world of Tanuki, where Gardeners, Geishas, Ninjas and tons of cute furry creatures clash in a race to cultivate the most productive bamboo garden. Will you try and get revenge or stay focused on your own garden? If you are looking for cute designs, fierce battles and strategic decision-making, then Tanuki is the game for you. Do you have what it takes to win in this no holds barred take that game? It's time to unleash your inner furry warrior!

Tanuki is a fast-paced card game where players compete to grow the most productive bamboo garden. During their turn, players play Action or Character cards, apply the cards’ effects and harvest bamboo from their gardens. Each Character card in the garden has its own unique abilities.

The game finishes once the harvest season has come to an end. The player with the most bamboo wins. Strategic decision-making and interaction between players are key elements of this game.

Love Cards Against Humanity but hate yourself? Buy these 150 unaffiliated, unofficial, but totally compatible cards for the world's most popular party game.
150 Cards (112 White, 38 Black)
Cards are the same size, weight, and finish as the original Cards Against Humanity cards

Figo is a party game for skydivers.

In each round, one person reads a card, and then the group decides who in the group should be tagged with that card.

The person with the most votes at the end of the game receives the title "Figo".

—description from the designer

Super Squad High is a cooperative teen superhero strategy game for 1 to 4 players. A crime wave has struck the city, and only Super Squad can save the day! Fight crime, keep up your grades, and become besties or sweethearts with your classmates to learn clues and unmask the villain behind the crime wave. The twist — the villain is secretly one of your classmates!

Features:

Narrative social encounters. Chat with non-player classmates to learn their likes, fears, and feelings, then use what you know to win them over as besties or sweethearts.

Fresh take on crime fighting. Your super powers and crime fighting gear are limited. Make difficult choices between saving the city buildings and citizens, taking bruises, or running late to class. Push your limits just like classic teen heroes from the comics!

Tense, thematic gameplay. Manage your time between schoolwork, fighting crime, and forming relationships with your classmates. Every choice matters as life pulls you in multiple directions.

Heroic teamwork. Use powers and costumes to back each other up. Patrol to get the drop on crime or face danger head-on to protect your teammates.

—description from the designer

Game Changer is a collection of 15 types of board games designed as an introduction box to modern board games.

Descriptions of the games:

The Action Game:
Summary: Are your reactions fast enough to be the first to snap on cards? Players take turns placing cards on the table as they race to ‘snap’ on all the correct cards. Similar to the classic game of snap. The game is played in rounds where players compete to be the first to fulfill a customer’s order (3 resource items).

Objective: Be the first player to snap on all the items that each customer wants in order to collect the active customer card. The first player to collect 3 customer cards wins the game!


The Abstract Game:
Summary: This game is like chess for the modern era. Two players sit on either side of the board and move Player Tokens across. Unlike chess, the board’s tiles dictate how the Player Tokens can be moved, not the Player Tokens.

Objective: Win by being the first player to move all 3 of your Player Tokens to the opposite side of the board.

The Bidding Game:
Summary: Players are at an auction each with the same amount of money. Can you outsmart your opponents by spending the least to gain the most? The game consists of 10 auctions where players bid on resources, aiming to have the most points at the end of the game.

Objective: Win by having the most points at the end of the game (after 10 auctions).

The Bluffing Game:
Summary: Can you lie without getting caught? Can you tell when others are lying? Each player starts with 5 coins and one animal card, each with its own special ability to earn or remove coins. Players can choose to lie or tell the truth about which animal card they have in order to earn or remove coins from other players.

Objective: Win by being the last player remaining with coins. This is a game of elimination.

The Co-op Game:
Summary: Players must work as a team to find and arrest the 2 Diamond thieves while protecting the innocent bystanders. To do this, each player must choose a card from their hand and perform the actions stated on the card. Winning will take real teamwork.

Objective: When both Diamond thieves are arrested everyone wins, but when 2 innocent bystanders are arrested everyone loses!

The Dice Game:
Summary: Seven animals race around a track while all players watch and bet, aiming to earn the most money by the end of the game. There are multiple ways of earning money including betting on the winners/losers or buying land (like Monopoly) that earns money when animals land on them.

Objective: The player who has the most money when the first animal reaches the finish line wins the game.

The Hidden Identity Game:
Summary: Can you figure out who among you are lying? Players are assigned a secret identity, which will either be on the innocent team or the guilty team. Players close their eyes while listening to an audio recording from Game Changer’s website, which instructs certain animals to perform specific actions while everyone else has their eyes closed. In the second phase of the game, all players open their eyes and discuss what happened in order to determine who the guilty team is, while the guilty team lie to try to not get caught!
â€‹
Objective: After 5 minutes of discussion, all players vote on who they think is the guilty team. If the majority vote is correct, the innocent team wins. If the majority vote is incorrect, the guilty team wins.

The Market Game:
Summary: Players visit a bustling market to buy and sell valuable resources in order to earn the most amount of money. Players must decide whether to claim, swap, trade, or sell resources to customers in order to profit the most.

Objective: The first player to reach $40 worth of coins wins the game!

The Memory Game:
Summary: This game combines memory and strategy. Resource Cards are placed face down on the table with players able to peek at any 2 cards to start their turn. The goal is to collect sets of matching Resource Cards by remembering their location on the table. Each player has their own memory bank where they can strategically store up to 2 sets of cards that will help them complete sets and stop other players from collecting them.

Objective: The game ends when there are no more Resource Cards left in the middle of the table. The player with the most cards collected wins.

The Numbers Game:
Summary: Are your reactions fast enough to be the first to snap on cards? Players take turns placing cards on the table as they race to ‘snap’ on all the correct cards. Similar to the classic game of snap. The game is played in rounds where players compete to be the first to fulfill a customer’s order (3 resource items).

Objective: Be the first player to snap on all the items that each customer wants in order to collect the active customer card. The first player to collect 3 customer cards wins the game!

The Party Game:
Summary: Are your reactions fast enough to be the first to snap on cards? Players take turns placing cards on the table as they race to ‘snap’ on all the correct cards. Similar to the classic game of snap. The game is played in rounds where players compete to be the first to fulfill a customer’s order (3 resource items).
â€‹
Objective: Be the first player to snap on all the items that each customer wants in order to collect the active customer card. The first player to collect 3 customer cards wins the game!

The Realtime Game:
Summary: This game involves a lot of yelling! Players simultaneously yell out the actions written on their cards to try to find another player yelling out the same action. Once a player has found a match, the matching players both perform that action e.g. ‘Team Spirit’, ‘Bro Bump’ or ‘Pinky Swear’. Both players then discard the Action Cards. The goal is to be the first player who finds matches for all their cards, therefore having zero Action Cards remaining in their hand.

Objective: The first player to discard all of the Action Cards in their hand wins.

The Set Collecting Game:
Summary: Players attempt to create the strongest sets to win, like in Poker. However, unlike Poker, there are 7 Resource Cards face up on the table which players compete for. Each resource card states a rule that explains how that card can be won. The player who satisfies the rule at the end of the game wins that resource card, and the player with the most resource card points wins the game.

Objective: The player with the highest total value of resource cards wins the game.

The Storytelling Game:
Summary: Players tell a funny group story using cards from their hand and trying to be the first player to use up all their cards. To use up their cards faster, players may interrupt other players’ stories using special cards. Each player also has their own pre-written custom ending which they need to use.

Objective: The first player to use up all their cards and end the story with their ending wins the game.

The Tile Game:
Summary: Place tiles on the table next to each other to create a continuous road. Be the first player to collect 3 Treasure Chests. Along the way, you’ll need to slow down your opponent(s) by re-routing and blocking their path(s) to ensure you are the first to collect the Treasure Chests.

Objective: The first player to collect 3 Treasure Chests wins the game.

Bound is a two player strategy game played on a single sheet of paper. Each turn, move one of your four standing stones in an attempt to encircle an opponent's stone.

Simple rules ensure that it is quick and easy to learn, but the unusual geometry of its pentacle-shaped board and the speed of its reversal of fortunes make Bound a dynamic and strategic contest.

—description from the designer

Boba Blitz is a 1-5 players card game featuring everyone's favourite bubble/boba tea! As the owner of your own bubble tea chain, your job is to outdo your competitors and attain boba supremacy!

Each turn, players can resupply to get more ingredients, toppings and flavours, assemble their bubble tea, sell it for money, purchase premium bubble tea flavours worth more points or sabotage their opponents. Once a player has sold all their available cups including a premium bubble tea flavour, the end-game is triggered.

Blend. Sell. Spill. Nobody is gonna get oolong after this!

—description from the designer

InCountry is a blistering fast paced tabletop game system used to represent modern day combat and intelligence operations.
â€‹
InCountry is a flexible game that can be played using two dimensional or three dimensional terrain with multiple players or playing by yourself!

Create exciting modern combat scenarios and play them in no time at all! Learn the rules in only a few minutes and enjoy intense tactical combat for hours on end.

InCountry plays extremely rules light and focuses on player strategy in relation to where and when their Models engage each other in combat! Forget adding +1's and +2's instead focus on applying real world military tactics to your games! 

The rulebook includes print at home intel cards and a full suite of rules for US Rangers, Russians, and Insurgents!

Also includes a full Armory to create your own forces, Scenarios, and indepth rules on how to play InCountry!

Christmas on Track is a festive roll-n-write game for 1 or more players. Lay train tracks to bring gifts from Santa's workshop to the gift wrapping station, then to the sleigh for delivery!

Each turn, roll three dice and choose two to use. If you choose a red die, use a red pencil; and a green pencil for the green die. Score for the longest track with the fewest dead ends.

1 or more players • 20 minutes 
Requires: 3 dice; red, green, and white. 2 pencils; red, and green.

-description from publisher

In the Monopoly: Marvel Studios' The Falcon and the Winter Soldier Edition game players go around the board buying up 3 different types of properties: events, hostile forces, and Wakandan tech.

Once you control color sets, you can double the rent and add Captain America Stars and Shields to charge even more rent. The last player with money when all others have gone bankrupt wins.

America's last Vietnam Battle - Linebacker II - the historic B-52 attacks against North Vietnam that brought (temporary) peace and got the American POWs home.  A fascinating air campaign simulation!

Playable as either a 2-player contest or SOLO against a "system" (for either side), one side plays the US forces charged with executing the American President's campaign to bring the North Vietnamese back to the conference table, while the other plays TWO adversaries - the North Vietnamese AND the SAC Command staff in Omaha!  Game play is organized by raid wave and combat is conducted for each attacking support sortie or cell of B-52s by each SAM battalion.  Wild Weasel, Iron Hand, chaff, ECM, MiGCAP, AAA, and GCI are all modeled in a realistic sim of this complex campaign.

134 minis including aircraft, SAMs, AAA - 22x34 campaign map - mission planning, event cards, attack wave layouts, SAM engagement board, airbase cards, rulebook, dice, roundels, counters, chips and more.

5D20 Football is a game built for the solo gamer. Everything runs off the roll of 5 d20 dice. The game is fairly simple yet has depth in how plays turnout. The tabletop version uses charts and dice.

To begin with the dice are rolled to get the play type, depth, and the who which is all based off a teams' offensive chart. The plays take into account the down, distance, and the ball location on the field. Later in the game, time left and the score can affect the play calls as well. This roll also on occasion can trigger a fumbled snap or a pre-snap penalty.

Once the play is known we progress to the play itself which require rolling 5d20 dice. To start, the red die gets you the defender for the play (this player comes off the defensive teams chart), and who the player is also depends on the game situation (a passing situation is more likely to get a player from the secondary while a run play is more likely to have a lineman).

For a PASS: The white die gives you how the defender affects the play. They can get pressure on a QB, get a chance to break up a pass, allow an open receiver, which will result in the receiver making a catch, a drop, or yards after a catch. The blue die is checked against the QB or the receiver, depending on what the defensive player allowed. The black die gets your yardage and the yellow die is for a possible penalty.

For a RUN: The white die gives you how the defender affects the play. They can get penetration and hit a runner in the backfield, hit the runner at the line, or allow a hole for the runner to run through. The blue die gets how the runner reacts to what the defense gave them by spinning away from a loss, to breaking a run through a hole. The black die gets you the yardage gained and the yellow die is used for a possible penalty.

Special team plays are as simple as rolling the 5d20 and using them to get distance, the returner and yardage, along with chances for penalties and fumbles.

Players are rated so that their impact in the game reflect their real life styles. So while the game may seem simple there is a ton of interaction allowing everything that happens in a football game to happen on the tabletop with 5D20 Football.

YOU START WITH THE ANSWERS
All the answers you need in Colourbrain are in your hand. And they’re all colours!

300 COLOURFUL QUESTIONS
What colour is the lid on full-fat milk… what colour is a sharon fruit… which colour cards would you put down?

ALL NEW QUESTIONS
This mini version of the game contains 120 brand new questions. Play it on its own or combine it with the full-sized version

Typical Spanish is a pop culture familiar party game. Create 2 groups and win by imitating, drawing, mimicking or answer correctly trivia questions about Spanish culture. Let's start the party and have some fun with friends ¡Olé!

Typical spanish es el primer juego de mesa familiar tipo party con pruebas sobre la cultura española más gamberra, ¡olé!
Imitar, dibujar, hacer mímica o adivinar solo serán algunas de las cosas que tendréis que hacer para ganar el juego de mesa más Typical Spanish
¡Qué comience el sarao! Tira un dado para saber de qué categoría tendréis que jugar la tarjeta durante esta ronda. El primer equipo que tenga una tarjeta de cada categoría ganará Typical Spanish, ¿quieres saber cuáles son?
Cómo está la people: si imitases a personajes muy nuestros como un bailaor flamenco, ¿crees que tu equipo lo adivinaría?
Hazte un Picasso: conviértete en un gran artista y pinta cosas como Naranjito para que los demás lo adivinen
Aquí hay tomate: hay frases míticas como ¡Hola, corazones!, ¿sabes quién las dijo por primera vez?
Spanish Trivial: preguntas sobre las cosas más curiosas de nuestra cultura y tres posibles respuestas. Sólamente una es la correcta
Blanco y en botella: decir expresiones españolas es muy sencillo, pero hacerlo moviendo los labios y gesticulando sin hablar para que el equipo las adivine es todo un reto
Pregúntale a Reverte: ¿podréis adivinar si las palabras propuestas están o no aceptadas por la RAE?
Ocupa poco espacio y sus cartas laminadas de calidad hacen que lo podáis jugar en casa, en la piscina, de viaje o en cualquier otro sitio

Revolution: State of War is a 2 player asymmetric military strategy on the Armed struggle for American Independence.  The primary objective is to establish and maintain the support of the population for your cause, but to do so often requires one to have control or possession of the territory where people live, and for that one must take command of your nation's forces, maneuver and engage in battles to secure the colonies.

Both sides have very unique and distinct advantages.  The British with their professional force and naval prowess can dominate coastal positions, but may have some difficulty when getting too far away from their coastal bases.  They know the longer the war drags on the more chances Americans will have to secure French support along with building up their forces to a higher standard.  As such, the British will want to hit the ground running and maintain the pressure, seeking out engagement after engagement to decimate the rebel forces so when they are better trained it will be immaterial at that point, or a day late and a dollar short.

The American's on the other hand need time to secure an alliance with the French and convert this rag-tag band of revolutionaries into a professional army to really flip the script but one doesn't always get the army they want, when they need it and have to fight with the army they have.  As such, to buy time and save face with the population the American forces will need to make the British advance as costly as possible by occupying advantageous terrain, leveraging the support of the population with Militia forces, and knowing when to simply run away.

The game incorporates cards but is not a card driven game, the cards provide enhancements and bonus abilities as well as enable deception actions that can really through a wrench in the works for your opponent.

When forces contest territory on the Game Board, the game zooms in to a unique battle sequence, which is a mini-game itself; units deploy into lanes of combat and roll dice to score hits and kills with bonuses and enhancements for aspects like rout, exposed flank (enfilade), and Dragoon Charge.

Can you lead your nations forces to victory?

—description from the designer

Achô! is a 9-in-1 card game that offers multiple ways to play and grows with your child. In this little box, you will find fun and the development of specific skills for various age groups.

Each game mode is designed for a specific age, offering just the right amount of fun and challenge!

Some games included:

Achô!
Flip cards and show them to your little ones. They must get the name of the figure right, which can have additional details such as color and size.

WHERE DID IT GO?
Show some cards and then turn them face down. Your little ones should try to remember where the requested card ended up.

Build a kingdom, trade, and face the Vikings in this captivating hybrid strategy game with the setting in the 11th century Ireland!

Irish clans and Vikings are competing for power and the island is split up between provincial kings, all of them trying to take the lead by exploring the land and be the first to take control of scarce resources. But no clan is safe from the Vikings who battles and plunder.

As a provincial king you lead your own Irish clan, with the ambition of winning the game. You always have to deal with the circumstances unique for each game play and there are several paths to victory: by kingdom building, conquest or economy.

The game flow follows a seasonal calendar, and through the year you explore new territories, gather resources and construct buildings and ships. You may also move your clan units and start battles.

During the fair military units may be recruited and you may trade resources in a challenging and unique dynamic trade system. The numerous development cards give you a possibility to gain a variety of new skills and enhance your military capabilities during the game.

Although the game contains an intriguing battle system, battle between players is downplayed. Focus for the battles is instead the exciting and automated Viking system, which includes both sea raids and ravaging Viking warbands to deal with.

The game is designed for high replayability, where each game session provides a new challenge and experience. 8 different kings can be combined with 4 different clans. The development of the economy, the activities of the Vikings, and alternative development cards are also factors that make each game session unique.

So, will you succeed with your chosen path, take control as the High King and proclaim yourself ‘Emperor of the Gaels’?

-description from designer

"Tank Commander: The Ardennes" is a Tactical-level, narrative-style Solitaire-only "print and play" board-wargame using a tables-based game engine where the player commands an American Army Sherman M4A3 tank fighting enemy German forces in the Belgian Ardennes during late 1944 to early 1945. As the commander of a Sherman M4A3 tank, your ultimate goal is to survive the 'Battle of the Bulge' until late January 1945, while at the same time killing as many German enemy units as possible.

With most of the rules integrated into the tables, there is practically no learning curve or rules memorization. And with detailed damage modeling, numerous crewmen skills, 12 types of enemy German Army units, battle weather effects, terrain types, random events, and a multitude of table modifiers, Tank Commander: The Ardennes offers memorable experiences and high replay value. Are you up to the challenge of surviving the Battle of the Bulge?

The player will move his tank around on the combat mat, fighting enemy units.

Game components include a crewmen placement mat, combat mat, tables book, crewmen status sheet, campaign log sheet, and counter sheet representing individual tanks, enemy units, etc.

The Great War: Short Bomber is a tactical-level, narrative-style solitaire print and play wargame using a tables-based game engine simulating the British RNAS nighttime bombing campaign against Germany during 1916-1917.

As the pilot of a Short bomber serving with the No.7 Squadron of the Royal Navy Air Service, your ultimate goal is to survive a 30-mission tour of duty during 1916-1917. Based in Petite-Synthe (Dunkirk), France, you and your observer will be assigned with taking part in nightly solo bombing and strafing raids against various German targets in occupied Belgium. But it won’t certainly be a cake walk, as your bomber will frequently encounter deadly FLAK, not to mention nighttime navigation challenges, petrol management, mechanical failures, and even wing icing. And of course, you and your crewmen are not allowed to wear parachutes, so forget about bailing out when things go wrong!

With most of the rules integrated into the tables, there is practically no learning curve or rules memorization. And with detailed damage modeling, fuel management, numerous crewmen skills, mission weather effects, random events, and a multitude of table modifiers, The Great War: Short Bomber offers memorable experiences and high replay value. Are you up to the challenge of surviving a 30-mission tour of duty?

The player will move his bomber through various travel boxes on a map during each mission on his way to the target zone, then must successfully return back to home base.

Game components include a crewmen placement mat, strategic map mat, tables book, crewmen status sheet, campaign log sheet, and counter sheet representing individual bombers, enemy units, etc.

River Rats: PBRs and PCFs in Vietnam is a tactical-level, narrative-style solitaire/2-player co-op print and play wargame using a tables-based game engine.

As the commander of either a US Navy PBR or PCF patrol boat operating in the Vietnam Mekong Delta region, your ultimate goal is to survive a 1-year Vietnam tour of duty during the year 1969. Encounter missions will include Viet Cong ambushes, MEDEVAC rescues, US SEAL/ARVN insertions and extractions, Sampan Stop and Searches, and Sampan Firefights.

The player will move his squadron through various travel boxes on a map during each mission, then must successfully return back to home base.

Game components include a crewmen placement mat, strategic map mat, tables book, crewmen status sheet, campaign log sheet, and counter sheet representing individual boats, enemy units, etc.

River Rats: SEAL Team is a tactical-level, narrative-style solitaire/2-player co-op print and play wargame using a tables-based game engine.

As the squad leader of an elite US Navy SEAL team operating in the Vietnam Mekong Delta region, your ultimate goal is to survive a 6-month Vietnam tour of duty during the year 1968. Mission assignments against the Viet Cong will include search & destroy, reconnaissance, downed US airmen rescues, demolition of VC structures, and VC officer assassinations.

With most of the rules integrated into the tables, there is practically no learning curve or rules memorization. And with numerous SEAL skills, weapons, mission types, possible tactics, weather effects, terrain types, random events, and a multitude of table modifiers, River Rats: SEAL Team offers high replay value. Are you up to the challenge?

The player will move his soldiers through various travel boxes on a map during each mission on his way to the assigned mission area, then must successfully return back to home base.

Game components include a crewmen placement mats, strategic map mat, tables book, crewmen status sheets, campaign log sheet, and counter sheets representing individual soldiers, weapons, equipment, etc.


     The game is available as Print and Play on Wargame Vault.

Two cosmic adventurers are in a tricky scenario and must work together. By rolling and manipulating dice for special abilities and combos, you can be the one that guides them to victory.

Save the Spacewhales is a scenario in the Twin Stars solo system by Jason Tagmire and Mike Mullins. The game consists of just 3 cards and players will provide their own dice and coins/tokens. Each scenario comes with 2 all-new characters and can be interchanged with others for a very different gaming experience.


This scenario was released as part of the Numbsters Kickstarter.

The moon is the next frontier of human civilization and mega-corporations rush to build colonies on the harsh lunar landscape. Joint ventures must be formed to complete the behemoth cities of the future, but the corporations, desperate to maximize profits and secure their legacy, never stop fighting for majority control.

In Lunar Chess, you and an opponent play as two such corporations. On your turn, you will add a card to the shared colony, enlarging groups of various development types: housing, crystal farms, and solar arrays. Every card you lay also activates the movement of your Speculator who is dispatched to make investments on your behalf. At the end of the game, you will identify the largest group of each development type. The player who made the majority of investments in these groups is the winner.

Lunar Chess borrows elements from Western chess and blends them with modern mechanisms like area control and tile-laying to create a unique gaming experience that feels part abstract and part strategy game. Lunar Chess is both tactical and strategic and is full of surprises.

-description from designer

3 CLUES Body, Bandage, White… MUMMY!! Itchy, Dog, Scratchy... FLEA!! Blow, Raise, Kite… WIND!!

Different "keys" appear on the cards, for example: "Sphinx". You have to give 3 clues, 3 words to your partner to discover the key... For example: "Egypt, huge" and your partner says: "Pyramid"; you say: "feline" and he yells: "Sphinx!", very good!

Now with hidden clues...

As the name suggests, the theme for this set is the ways to say “I love you”; this can be sweet, like breakfast in bed, or sour, like a black eye. Who and what we love changes, and we all have unique ways of showing it.

—description from the designer

Imagine everything happy and sweet thrown into one box, and you know what this set contains. This could mean a lot of wholesome cards in a round of play, or it can easily turn into throwing puppies to a shark. You can decide.

—description from the designer

Ready to play like a pirate? In this exciting fast paced card game, you are the pirate. Throw cannonballs at your friends ships. There are monkeys, parrots, coconuts and more to help you become the ruler of the seas. Pirate Blast is fun for all ages. See if you AARRGH the craftiest pirate and claim Monkey Island.

Using the cards you draw, sink your friends ships while trying to keep your ship afloat. Have the least damaged ship when everyone runs out of cards to win! Game contains enough cards for four ships. Each player gets 19 supply cards that includes monkeys, dolphins, cannon balls, bananas, coconuts, rum bottles and an octopus.

Word Wipeout is the fast-paced word game that's sure to elevate your next family game night!  Race to collect the most letters by spelling a word related to the category.  The rounds get progressively more challenging as fewer letters remain.  Pick from 200 beginner or advanced categories in a race to get the word out!

This festive collection of brainteasers and challenges will entertain the whole family! Great for groups and easy to play. Just spin the dial to choose a category and draw a card.

—description from the publisher

A fun, fast and easy to learn card matching game where you race to spit out words in topics like Disney Princesses, Ben & Jerry's flavors, Queen songs, and YouTube videos before your opponent.

Players flip cards until the symbols on two players cards match. Matching players raced to give an example of the category on their opponents card.

Wild Cards create unexpected matches, and losing a car can set off a chain of cascading face-offs.

Includes three (3) unique Anomia Pop Culture decks, each containing 72 different category cards (movies, TV, music, the internet, and more!), 7 wild cards and 2 customizable blank cards. A 2-player variation available in the rules.

Slipstream is a two-player abstract racing game.

Both players run four near-future machines, accumulate points obtained by being the first to pass some of the seven checkpoints and the first-come-first-served goal, and hope that their team will get more than half of all points.

The only random element is creating the race course. Players alternate moving their machines. The course has oval and circle spots. Machines must stop on oval spots but may continue through circles. Players should take advantage of slip streaming behind vehicles in the lead as it allows passing through oval spots.

In this family game Kvantum (Quantum) you become captains of spaceships! Navigate your spaceships with the help of cute aliens to reach the planet Quantum first. You can find your way to it if you put the navigation cards with numbers correctly.

The game will not only help practice tactical thinking, but it also tests basic speed counting.

OBJECTIVE OF THE GAME
The objective of the game is to use the alien cards to put together the correct numbers (quanta) and reach the planet Quantum first.

PREPARATION OF THE GAME
Place the game board in the middle of the table. You can choose from two track lengths. Shuffle the alien cards and place them face down near the game board.
Each player chooses a piece, places it on the start and takes five alien cards from the refi lling pack into their hand.
Place the shuffled navigation cards with the planets face down next to the game plan.

COURSE OF THE GAME
Select the starting player who becomes the captain. The game is played in rounds, each round has four phases.

1) Course settings
The captain turns over the navigation card with the planet on it.
Each player tries as quickly as possible to find the sum of the numbers on the cards in their hand that will result in the same number as the number on the laid out navigation card.
Once the player finds the correct cards, they lay them out in front of them. If a player cannot make a number, they can lay out just one card of the same colour as the number on the planet navigation card.
The player who laid out the cards as last or cannot lay out anything cannot fly.

2) Flight
If the players have laid out the cards correctly (sum or colour), they may keep the cards laid out and arrange them on the table in front of them. If not, they throw these cards away.
Players who have laid out their cards correctly will move up the game board by the number of fields corresponding to the number of cards they have laid out.

3) Alien technology
The alien cards that players have laid out in front of them have various effects that can be used to advance towards the objective.
If a player uses four cards of the same colour with any values, they move their rocket (figure) three fields forward. Each type (colour) of alien has a different special ability. If you manage to create a sequence of four cards of the same colour (e.g. 3, 4, 5, 6), you can use special alien technology.

4) Energy replenishment
All players may discard any number of cards from their hand to the discard pack. Players then take turns taking cards from the refi lling pack so that they have five in their hand. The player to the left of the captain takes the pack of navigation cards and becomes the captain for the next round.

END OF THE GAME
The game ends on the round when the first player reaches the Quantum planet. The other players fi nish the round. If more players reach the destination during the last round, they all win.
Contains the base game and the Saga expansion in an exclusively hot stamped wooden box.

Project:Waifur is a strategical Collectible Card Game where you summon a team of digital beings called "Waifur" to fight for you within a virtual space.

Upgrade your waifur and enhance them by installing several programs such as weapons, supports, skills, viruses and many more.

Build the ultimate deck and challenge your rivals to an exciting CYBER-BATTLE!

Experience unique features, such as:
\ COOLDOWN: Played cards eventually return!
\ CHARGING: Pay for card cost with any card!
\ CANCEL: Hinder your opponents progress!
\ ESCALATION: Play hands of 20+ cards!

—description from the designer

It's 1995...you've got a paper due first thing in the morning and your trusty computer has chosen tonight to slow to a crawl. You reboot, you task kill, you pet the monitor gently, no dice. You're filled with dread as you realize you have only one option left. That's right.

Clear your schedule, baby, it's time to D-D-D-DEFRAG!

Defrag is a hand management grid puzzle game in which you are attempting to rearrange and consolidate various file fragments before exhausting your resources. Defrag has several solo and multiplayer game modes, including a series of increasingly difficult challenges with unique goals.

East Prussian Carnage, is an Operational level board-wargame covering the World War 1 Battle of Tannenberg and the Masurian Lakes in August 1914 between Germany and Russia.

The battle for Tannenberg and the Masurian Lakers is one of the most famous battles in history. Even though the battle was insignificant in numbers of forces engaged compared to other battles fought during World War I, it represent a master-piece of exercising modern military strategy. One of the most astonishing victories ever was scored in a classical battle of local superiority and manoeuvre.

The game mechanics includes a chit-pull procedure. The low density of units provides a fast-pace battle where every move is vital for victory.
The game is taught in 30 minutes and is easy to digest yet a challenge even for the more experienced players.

Game Scale:
Turn: 2 days
Hex: 6.2 miles / 10 km
Units: Brigade to Army

—description from the publisher

If Kufuhi and Kotoba, an apprentice witch comes across a dragon who changes colors depending upon what it is near.

The game includes a set of translucent color cards and one player tries to describe a word or phrase (e.g. internet or classical music) with these cards.

The game includes both competitive and cooperative play modes.

Hedges is a two-player shedding game with a traditional deck. You score for 5s, 10s, and Kings captured while playing combos—but only the player who sheds out their hand first. Otherwise they count against you as negative points. As you capture point cards you decide if they’ll be claimed or "hedged". Hedging means they don't score for anyone, mitigating cards that would otherwise score negative–but you’ll suffer being too cautious. The player best able to predict if and when she’ll go out, skillfully mitigate losses along the way, along with an occasional well-placed gamble and bluff, will win the most points.

Part of the "Two-player Climbing Trilogy": Hedges, Tuhao, Eat or Run.

—description from the designer

Fjord Serpents is a unique and dynamic miniatures war game, set within Dark Age Scandinavia during the apex of the Viking Age.

As a Viking Jarl you assemble your fleet and crew and compete against rivals through balanced, matched play games, or upon a heroic campaign arc of conquest and domination.

Strategic acumen, dynamic flair and a little battle luck are required to master the Viking Fjords and win. Every decision is important and every crew and ship piece plays a vital role in-game, acting independently or in unison with other pieces.

It is fast paced Viking battle; fought as they did at the time, on the mighty Fjords which connected them, and upon the very dragon ships which gave them their greatness.

Historical in nature and deeply researched, Fjord Serpents will appeal to a wide audience of gamers; from history buffs, lovers of Viking age and culture, competitive or casual wargamers, to board game enthusiasts and strategists.

Included in the box are all the ships and crew miniatures required to field 2x Hersir size naval fleets for 2 players or enough to field one king size naval engagements for 1 player; plus all the rules, tokens, gauges, terrain and dice to play.

—description from designer

Coral Sea Solitaire places you in command of American carriers in the Pacific in May 1942 against an opposing Japanese autonomous player side, referred to as the BOT side. The object of the game for the American player is to earn the victory points of the mission goal BEFORE the Japanese invasion convoy reaches Port Moresby.

You lead the aircraft carriers Lexington and Yorktown as they sortie into the Coral Sea to stop the Japanese invasion that threatens Australia. You must contend with 3 Japanese carriers roaming the Coral Sea determined to finish off the US Navy. The Bookgame contains 4 game sets, and each game set is against a different Japanese carrier strategy. There are 5 distinct missions within each game set for you to win and defeat the Japanese.

This Bookgame contains 4 game sets, and each game set is against a different Japanese carrier strategy. There are 5 distinct missions within each game set for you to win and defeat the Japanese. Making a total of 20 distinct game plays.

You will need to provide two 6-sided dice to play the game.

Coral Sea Solitaire can also be played cooperatively. For example, one player commands the Lexington, and the other commands the Yorktown.

—description from the publisher

Verborgen im Museum ("Hidden in a  museum") is an escape game full of riddles and puzzles that consists only of cards.

This game is about a long forgotten treasure that is hidden in a museum. The exhibits in the museum mysteriously lead the way to the hiding place. Can the players solve the riddles and find the treasure before it falls into the wrong hands and is gone forever?

By the way: The game material remains intact and can therefore be used again and again.

Suritsu is a game of number and scenery making for 1 to 5 players.

Players play cards from their hands, connecting with previously played cards to create a two-digit number. The number that can be made changes depending on which side the "UP-DOWN card" ois showing. If the UP side is showing, a number larger than the previously played number must be played. If the DOWN side is showing, a smaller number must be played.

In addition to numbers, each card has lavishly illustrated "scenery", such as forests, the sea, and city. By completing scenery through card play, you can perform consecutive turns.

Skillfully manipulate the available numbers to ensure your opponents cannot play, allowing you to empty your hand!
